contentrichtext.text: '''Quinton-Steele Botes''' (born April 30, 1960) is a [[Namibia]]n Sport Consultant.<ref>[[Namibia Economist]]:''Quinton-Steele Botes, the well-known sports consultant''[http://www.economist.com.na/content/view/4524/ Quinton calls it quits from Athletics Namibia]</ref> He received an award for sporting excellence from the [[International Olympic Committee]] in 2003<ref>''Botes wins International Olympic Committee award''[http://www.k7.com.na/blog/?page_id=4 Botes wins International Olympic Committee award]</ref> in recognition of his promotion of [[Athletics (sport)|athletics]] in [[Namibia]] As technical manager of the [[Namibia at the Olympics|Namibian Olympic Team]] he attended 2 Olympic Games, 3 World Games, 1 African Games and 2 Commonwealth Games. In 2005 Botes resigned from Athletics Namibia.<ref>[[The Namibian]]: ''"I have already resigned and have nothing to do with Athletics Namibia," said Botes.''[http://www.namibian.com.na/2005/December/sport/05F172FA3D.html Botes 'officially expelled' from athletics]</ref> Botes is a second level tutor of the [[IAAF]] and a course director of the [[International Olympic Committee]]<ref>Namibia Economist: ''He was also course director and lecturer for the International Association of Athletics Federation and the International Olympic Committee''[http://www.economist.com.na/content/view/4524/ Quinton calls it quits from Athletics Namibia]</ref> On 20 September 2007 Botes was diagnosed with [[Multiple Myeloma]], a type of cancer.
